title: How to Make a Duck Fart

steps.title: Get a shot glass, but don't add any ice.
steps.content: Get a shot glass, but don't add any ice. This drink is best enjoyed at room temperature. The ice will also only disrupt the layers. The glass should also be clear, so that you can see the layers.

steps.title: Pour the Kahlua into glass.
steps.content: Pour the Kahlua into glass. Aim it into the middle of the glass, so that you don't get any on the sides. Getting liquid on the sides could mess up the later layers.

steps.title: Place a spoon over the Kahlua.
steps.content: Place a spoon over the Kahlua. Turn the spoon upside down, so the dome part is facing up. The tip should be touching the inside wall of the glass, just above the Kahlua. The spoon will help you pour the next two layers slowly, and keep them intact. [1] X Research source Some people find it easier if the tip of the spoon is just touching the Kahlua. Other people prefer to hold it just a little higher up. You may need to experiment with what is easiest for you.

steps.title: Slowly pour the Bailey's Irish Cream over the spoon.
steps.content: Slowly pour the Bailey's Irish Cream over the spoon. Make sure that you are pouring towards the hand that's holding the spoon. Move the spoon upwards as the liquid level rises in the glass. Don't let the tip of the spoon get inside the liquid. Patience is key. The slower you pour, the better. If you pour too fast, the layers will mix. Don't worry if the layers start to mix. If this happens, stop and wait a few seconds. They will eventually settle and separate.

steps.title: Slowly finish off with the Crown Royal on top.
steps.content: Slowly finish off with the Crown Royal on top. Use the same spoon method as you did for the Irish Cream. Try to fill the glass as close to the rim as possible. Don't worry about spills. You can always wipe them up.

steps.title: Drink it in one go.
steps.content: Drink it in one go. Don't sip it. The flavors won't blend right. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Use Grand Marnier instead of Crown Royal to make a B-52.
steps.content: Use Grand Marnier instead of Crown Royal to make a B-52. [3] X Research source A B-52 is made in the exact same way as a Duck Fart. Instead of Crown Royal, however, it uses Grand Marnier. The proportions are exactly the same. Prepare a B-51 the same way as a Duck Fart, but use Frangelico hazelnut liqueur instead.

steps.title: Make a Duck Fart coffee.
steps.content: Make a Duck Fart coffee. Pour the Bailey's, Crown Royal, and Kahlua into a 12 to 16 ounce (350 to 475 milliliters) coffee mug. Add some fresh, brewed coffee, almost to the brim. Top off with whipped cream and crème de cacao. Here's what you'll need to make a Duck Fart coffee: 1 ½ ounces (45 milliliters) Bailey's® Irish cream 1 ½ ounces (45 milliliters) Crown Royal® Canadian whisky 1 ½ ounces (45 milliliters) Kahlua® coffee liqueur 6 - 10 ounces (180 – 260 milliliters) fresh, brewed coffee Whipped cream (to taste) Crème de cacao (to taste)

steps.title: Make a Taiwan Duck Fart.
steps.content: Make a Taiwan Duck Fart. Pour the Seagram's 7, Kahlua, and Bailey's into a cocktail shaker. Add some ice and shake it to mix. Pour the drink through a strainer into a shot glass, and serve. Here's what you'll need to make a Taiwan Duck Fart: 1/3 ounce (10 milliliters) Seagram's® 7 whisky 1/3 ounce (10 milliliters) Kahlua® coffee liqueur 1/3 ounce (10 milliliters) Bailey's® Irish cream

steps.title: Try a Moose Fart by adding some vodka and blending it with ice.
steps.content: Try a Moose Fart by adding some vodka and blending it with ice. Pour equal parts of Kahlua, Bailey's, Crown Royal, and vodka into a blender. Add some ice, and blend until it becomes thick. Serve the drink in a shot glass.
